title: Product of Sine and Cosine
text: The formula for the product of sine and cosine is sin(a)cos(b)=1/2[sin(a+b)+sin(a-b)].

title: Substituting Angles
text: Substitute the given values for the angles into the formula and simplify to rewrite the product as an equivalent sum.

title: Identifying angle a
text: From the left hand side of the formula in the structure of sin(a)cos(b), what is the angle of a?

title: Identifying angle $$b$$
text: From the left hand side of the formula in the structure of sin(a)cos(b), what is the angle of $$b$$?

title: Plug Into Formula and Simplify
text: To write the product of sine and cosine into a sum containing only sine, plug in the values of a and $$b$$ into the formula. Keep the $$\frac{1}{2}$$ in the final answer as a constant.
